subject: [PATCH] mm: name the anonymous MMOP enum as enum mmop

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jonathan Cameron noted that the patch does not address the issue of the enum mmop being anonymous, and suggested renaming it to a proper type name so the compiler can help catch invalid values being assigned.
reviews.raw_body:
On Wed, 11 Feb 2026 16:54:47 -0500
Gregory Price <gourry@gourry.net> wrote:

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch does not change any functionality and only renames an anonymous enum, which is a minor improvement.
reviews.raw_body:
Reviewed-by: Jonathan Cameron <jonathan.cameron@huawei.com>

Thanks for cleaning this up!

J

2026-02-19.patch_summary: This patch renames the anonymous MMOP enum to 'enum mmop' to allow the compiler to catch invalid values being assigned to variables of this type. The existing functions returning int are left unchanged, allowing for the value-or-error pattern to remain intact without introducing additional changes. The enum definition is moved before the CONFIG_MEMORY_HOTPLUG guard to ensure it's available for struct memory_block in memory.h. No functional change is introduced by this patch.

reviews.author: Cheatham, Benjamin
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch was previously reviewed and improved upon, and requested a Reviewed-by tag for himself.
reviews.raw_body:
I saw this when reviewing another set of yours and thought about mentioning it, glad you cleaned it up!

One small nit below, otherwise:
Reviewed-by: Ben Cheatham <benjamin.cheatham@amd.com>

reviews.author: Cheatham, Benjamin
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch does not follow standard kernel coding conventions and requested alignment of the comment.

2026-02-11.patch_summary: This patch renames the anonymous MMOP enum to 'enum mmop' to allow the compiler to catch invalid values being assigned to variables of this type. The existing functions returning int are left unchanged, allowing for the value-or-error pattern to remain intact without introducing additional changes. reviews.author: Gregory Price (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledges the enum declaration is already unaligned, but suggests it's not worth a separate patch revision (v2) unless reviewer Andrew has strong preferences.
reviews.raw_body:
Ah yeah was already unaligned. Bleh.

Probably not worth a full v2 unless Andrew prefers that.

~Gregory
